evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Case 1:25-cv-00458-ABA

extracted.value: Case 1:25-cv-00458-ABA

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiffs, vs. CONSUMER FINANCIAL PROTECTION BUREAU, 1700 G Street NW Washington, DC 20552, and RUSSELL VOUGHT, in his official capacity as Acting Director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, 725 17th St NW Washington, D.C. 20503, Defendants.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs: Mayor and City Council of Baltimore, Economic Action Maryland Fund; Defendants: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, Russell Vought

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau was established in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis by the Consumer Financial Protection Act (“CFPA”), which is Title X of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act.

extracted.value: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau was established in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis by the Consumer Financial Protection Act (“CFPA”), which is Title X of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: CFPB’s statutory funding mechanism, by which it draws funds directly from the Federal Reserve System of which it is a part

extracted.value: CFPB’s statutory funding mechanism draws funds directly from the Federal Reserve System.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Defendants have already announced their intention not to draw additional funds for the CFPB, claiming that the agency’s existing operating reserves are sufficient.

extracted.value: Defendants have announced their intention not to draw additional funds for the CFPB, claiming that the agency’s existing operating reserves are sufficient.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: On February 7, 2025, President Trump named Office of Management and Budget Director Russell Vought as the Acting Director of the CFPB.

extracted.value: On February 7, 2025, President Trump named Office of Management and Budget Director Russell Vought as the Acting Director of the CFPB.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Vought moved quickly to hamstring the Bureau and its operations after being named Acting Director.

extracted.value: Vought moved quickly to hamstring the Bureau and its operations after being named Acting Director.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: On February 8, the day after he became Acting Director, Vought instructed CFPB employees via an all-hands email to “stand down from performing any work task.”

extracted.value: On February 8, the day after he became Acting Director, Vought instructed CFPB employees via an all-hands email to “stand down from performing any work task.”

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: That same day, Vought notified the Board of Governors that, as Acting Director, he was requesting $0 for the third quarter of fiscal year 2025.

extracted.value: That same day, Vought notified the Board of Governors that, as Acting Director, he was requesting $0 for the third quarter of fiscal year 2025.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Vought’s letter implied that the Bureau would be able to rely on a purported reserve balance of $711,586,678 to continue carrying out its authorities during the third quarter of fiscal year 2025.

extracted.value: Vought’s letter implied that the Bureau would be able to rely on a purported reserve balance of $711,586,678 to continue carrying out its authorities during the third quarter of fiscal year 2025.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: The next day, Sunday, February 9, the Bureau’s Chief Operating Office emailed all CFPB employees informing them that the Bureau’s D.C. headquarters would be closed from February 10 through February 14.

extracted.value: The next day, Sunday, February 9, the Bureau’s Chief Operating Office emailed all CFPB employees informing them that the Bureau’s D.C. headquarters would be closed from February 10 through February 14.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Also on February 9, Vought said that the CFPB has been “a woke and weaponized agency against disfavored industries and individuals for a long time.”

extracted.value: Also on February 9, Vought said that the CFPB has been “a woke and weaponized agency against disfavored industries and individuals for a long time.”

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Elon Musk posted on social media, “CFPB has $711M? That money should be returned to taxpayers.”

extracted.value: Elon Musk posted on social media, “CFPB has $711M? That money should be returned to taxpayers.”

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Defendant Vought has said that he intends to cut off the CFPB’s funding, which comes directly from the Federal Reserve.

extracted.value: Defendant Vought has said that he intends to cut off the CFPB’s funding, which comes directly from the Federal Reserve.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: During fiscal year 2024 this cap was $785.4 million.

extracted.value: During fiscal year 2024 this cap was $785.4 million.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: During that year, the CFPB requested and received from the Federal Reserve Board four transfers totaling $729.4 million.

extracted.value: During that year, the CFPB requested and received from the Federal Reserve Board four transfers totaling $729.4 million.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: At the end of fiscal year 2024, the CFPB had a total Treasury account balance of approximately $200 million.

extracted.value: At the end of fiscal year 2024, the CFPB had a total Treasury account balance of approximately $200 million.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: The Supreme Court confirmed that the CFPB’s statutory funding mechanism meets the requirements of the Appropriations Clause in CFPB v. Community Financial Services Association of America, Ltd., 601 U.S. 416 (2024).

extracted.value: The Supreme Court confirmed that the CFPB’s statutory funding mechanism meets the requirements of the Appropriations Clause in CFPB v. Community Financial Services Association of America, Ltd., 601 U.S. 416 (2024).

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Baltimore is the largest city in Maryland, with a population of over 600,000. According to the 2020 Census, 60 percent of Baltimore’s population is Black, 27 percent is White, 8 percent is Hispanic or Latino, and 2.5 percent is Asian.

extracted.value: Baltimore is the largest city in Maryland, with a population of over 600,000. According to the 2020 Census, 60 percent of Baltimore’s population is Black, 27 percent is White, 8 percent is Hispanic or Latino, and 2.5 percent is Asian.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Many residents of the City of Baltimore have historically experienced unfair lending and consumer practices.

extracted.value: Many residents of the City of Baltimore have historically experienced unfair lending and consumer practices.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: The CFPB provides services to Baltimore via its consumer complaint database.

extracted.value: The CFPB provides services to Baltimore via its consumer complaint database.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Economic Action uses CFPB data for advocacy and direct services.

extracted.value: Economic Action uses CFPB data for advocacy and direct services.
